commit_message:
Allow multiple validation sources

This changes the code for listing and running validations to allow for
multiple directories -- e.g. the "official" tripleo-validations one plus
validations the deployers write internally.

Change-Id: Ib51f896ac9b1f1532ddd902bd91e7464eb8e572b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/58/357258/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def validation_paths(colon_separated_paths): '''Return paths to all validations. The input is a string of colon-separated directory paths. It behaves similarly to the PATH environment variable in unix shells. ''' directories = colon_separated_paths.split(':') result = [] for directory in directories: validations = glob.glob(os.path.join(directory, '*.yaml')) result.extend(sorted(validations)) return result def validation_id(validation_path): '''Take the full path to the validation file and return the ID. A validation's ID is just the filename without its location or extension. ''' return os.path.splitext(os.path.basename(validation_path))[0] paths = validation_paths(constants.DEFAULT_VALIDATIONS_PATH) loaded = set() val_id = validation_id(validation_path) if val_id not in loaded and \ (not groups or set.intersection(set(groups), set(validation_groups))): loaded.add(val_id) results.append({ 'id': val_id, for path in validation_paths(constants.DEFAULT_VALIDATIONS_PATH): if validation == validation_id(path): return path
deleted_lines: paths = glob.glob('{}/*.yaml'.format(constants.DEFAULT_VALIDATIONS_PATH)) if not groups or \ set.intersection(set(groups), set(validation_groups)): results.append({ 'id': os.path.splitext( os.path.basename(validation_path))[0], return '{}/{}.yaml'.format(constants.DEFAULT_VALIDATIONS_PATH, validation)

commit_message:
Set default/fix version numbers in upgrade script

This commit does the following:

1. Sets a default for I_REALLY_KNOW_WHAT_I_AM_DOING

Without this default, the script will error due to an unbound variable.
This happens as we have a 'set -u' specified in the script.

2. Updates version numbers from 11->12 to 12->13

Change-Id: I97c02d44722342b1867b4400921a66e6b2ea8a48
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/47/358847/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export I_REALLY_KNOW_WHAT_I_AM_DOING=${I_REALLY_KNOW_WHAT_I_AM_DOING:-"false"} This script will perform a v12.x to v13.x upgrade. echo "Running Upgrade from v12.x to v13.x"
deleted_lines: This script will perform a v11.x to v12.x upgrade. echo "Running Upgrade from v11.x to v12.x"

commit_message:
Added jasmine-core to dev dependencies.

This will address this error from the logs:

The peer dependency jasmine-core@* included from karma-jasmine will no
longer be automatically installed to fulfill the peerDependency
in npm 3+. Your application will need to depend on it explicitly.

Change-Id: I02455eb0c6e438154741e516e6cfb9a9791a23ff

commit_message:
Fix some minor errors in the doc

1.remove the # - it makes copy and paste very difficult
2.change "ubuntu" to "Ubuntu"
3.add "Restart docker by executing the following commands: "

TrivialFix

commit_message:
py3:Remove six.iterXXX

1、As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems/keys
   achieve iterators. We can use dict.items/keys instead, as it
   will return iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will
   more readable.
2、In py2, the performance about list should be negligible,
   see the link [2].

  [1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
  [2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/
      2015-June/066391.html

TrivialFix.

Change-Id: I0cbe8af3210233a58d25f0df187c3d085405aa2a

commit_message:
Make tox respect upper-constraints.txt

This will force pip install to use the upper-constraints.txt specified
version of pip modules. When you don't do this, you are out on the
bleeding edge and become unstable everytime some python library in the
wide world changes in a way that you don't expect.

Post jobs are not yet compatible with the upper-constraints file, so
override the install_command there to skip upper-constraints.

Credit to the equivalent Ironic patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/300146/

Change-Id: Ica668afedf622a0be8e8566ac88e1d0020ed9bc7
Closes-Bug: #1563038
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector refs/changes/00/301700/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: install_command = pip install -U -c{env:UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE:https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/plain/upper-constraints.txt} {opts} {packages}# NOTE(amrith) The setting of the install_command in this location # is only required because currently infra does not actually # support constraints files for the cover job, and while # the environment variable UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is set, there's # no file there. It can be removed when infra changes this. install_command = pip install -U {opts} {packages}# NOTE(amrith) The setting of the install_command in this location # is only required because currently infra does not actually # support constraints files for the cover job, and while # the environment variable UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is set, there's # no file there. It can be removed when infra changes this. install_command = pip install -U {opts} {packages}# NOTE(amrith) The setting of the install_command in this location # is only required because currently infra does not actually # support constraints files for the cover job, and while # the environment variable UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is set, there's # no file there. It can be removed when infra changes this. install_command = pip install -U {opts} {packages}

commit_message:
Automatically detect whether to test all integrated roles

This patch implements an automated determination of whether the
systems deployed by the integrated repository should be tested by
tempest based on whether there are hosts in the applicable host
groups.

This reduces the number of variables that need to be set by CI
system which make use of tempest.

Change-Id: I48a965f6b287b396c3d1c8c1d599374e06708e32

added_lines: def test_compare_volumes_from_neg(self): container_info = {'HostConfig': dict(VolumesFrom=['777f7dc92da7'])} self.dw = get_DockerWorker({'volumes_from': ['777f7dc92da7']}) self.assertFalse(self.dw.compare_volumes_from(container_info)) def test_compare_volumes_from_post(self): container_info = {'HostConfig': dict(VolumesFrom=['777f7dc92da7'])} self.dw = get_DockerWorker({'volumes_from': ['ba8c0c54f0f2']}) self.assertTrue(self.dw.compare_volumes_from(container_info)) def test_compare_volumes_neg(self): container_info = {'Config': dict(Volumes=['/var/log/kolla/']), 'HostConfig': dict(Binds=['kolla_logs:/var/log/kolla/:rw'])} self.dw = get_DockerWorker({'volumes': ['kolla_logs:/var/log/kolla/:rw']}) self.assertFalse(self.dw.compare_volumes(container_info)) def test_compare_volumes_pos(self): container_info = {'Config': dict(Volumes=['/var/log/kolla/']), 'HostConfig': dict(Binds=['kolla_logs:/var/log/kolla/:rw'])} self.dw = get_DockerWorker({'volumes': ['/dev/:/dev/:rw']}) self.assertTrue(self.dw.compare_volumes(container_info)) def test_compare_environment_neg(self): container_info = {'Config': {'Env': ['KOLLA_CONFIG_STRATEGY=COPY_ALWAYS', 'KOLLA_BASE_DISTRO=ubuntu', 'KOLLA_INSTALL_TYPE=binary'] } } self.dw = get_DockerWorker({ 'environment': dict(KOLLA_CONFIG_STRATEGY='COPY_ALWAYS', KOLLA_BASE_DISTRO='ubuntu', KOLLA_INSTALL_TYPE='binary')}) self.assertFalse(self.dw.compare_environment(container_info)) def test_compare_environment_pos(self): container_info = {'Config': {'Env': ['KOLLA_CONFIG_STRATEGY=COPY_ALWAYS', 'KOLLA_BASE_DISTRO=ubuntu', 'KOLLA_INSTALL_TYPE=binary'] } } self.dw = get_DockerWorker({ 'environment': dict(KOLLA_CONFIG_STRATEGY='COPY_ALWAYS', KOLLA_BASE_DISTRO='centos', KOLLA_INSTALL_TYPE='binary')}) self.assertTrue(self.dw.compare_environment(container_info))

commit_message:
Change Murano API detection in tests and fix tests itself

- Use 401 error to determine work of Murano API in shell via curl
- Change tempest parameters in utils
- Rename mistralclient.py to workflowclient.py due names conflict in
path.

Closes-Bug: #1614602

Change-Id: I91bdda91da929b183393c4210af86bce619a53ec

commit_message:
Remove an unnecessary assignment

After assigning "not available" to 'status',
an exception is reraised and 'status' is not used
any more. So this assignment is useless.

TrivialFix
Change-Id: If40e75a882bfa1d56b936227d306fe477bb18b00

commit_message:
Move other-requirements.txt to bindep.txt

The default filename for documenting binary dependencies has been
changed from "other-requirements.txt" to "bindep.txt" with the release
of bindep 2.1.0. While the previous name is still supported, it will
be deprecated.

Move the file around to follow this change.

Note that this change is self-testing, the OpenStack CI infrastructure
will use a "bindep.txt" file to setup nodes for testing.

For more information about bindep, see also:
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#package-requirements
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/bindep/

As well as this announcement:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-August/101590.html

Change-Id: I453bc2dbba89638e1adaf3d305bc4d1b003f7f23

commit_message:
Move other-requirements.txt to bindep.txt

The default filename for documenting binary dependencies has been
changed from "other-requirements.txt" to "bindep.txt" with the release
of bindep 2.1.0. While the previous name is still supported, it will
be deprecated.

Move the file around to follow this change.

Note that this change is self-testing, the OpenStack CI infrastructure
will use a "bindep.txt" file to setup nodes for testing.

For more information about bindep, see also:
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#package-requirements
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/bindep/

As well as this announcement:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-August/101590.html

Change-Id: I26370075455bed48641c5799758907ae91949ccc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/salt-formula-glance refs/changes/25/355025/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Move other-requirements.txt to bindep.txt

The default filename for documenting binary dependencies has been
changed from "other-requirements.txt" to "bindep.txt" with the release
of bindep 2.1.0. While the previous name is still supported, it will
be deprecated.

Move the file around to follow this change.

Note that this change is self-testing, the OpenStack CI infrastructure
will use a "bindep.txt" file to setup nodes for testing.

For more information about bindep, see also:
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#package-requirements
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/bindep/

As well as this announcement:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-August/101590.html

commit_message:
[install] Block storage node requires python-keystone

On RDO, the cinder volume components on the block storage
node require python-keystone. However, the RDO packages do
not install this package. Thus, we must install it manually.

backport: mitaka
Closes-Bug: #1584665
Change-Id: Iaecc0ad23aeb29154d371446cc57458c605eb545

commit_message:
Allow to change interfaces configuration for nodes that errored on deployment

This commit fixes the issue that it is not possible to recover after
deploying/redeploying a node with broken network interfaces config.
We allow interfaces configuration for a set of node error states
including discover and deploy actions.

Minor: Fix pep8 line length complaint.

Change-Id: I8dbaf96c1f89f77e7963d164d2ca4648bcd77fca
Closes-bug: #1592998

[arch-design] Storage section restructure

1. New structure seperating sections into seperate chapters
2. No new content yet, just old content restructured.

Implements: blueprint arch-guide-restructure
Change-Id: I67ca4b36d8a16a0ba863524923874a0a818b287f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/10/356310/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ============= Block storage ============= Block storage (sometimes referred to as volume storage) provides users with access to block-storage devices. Users interact with block storage by attaching volumes to their running VM instances. These volumes are persistent: they can be detached from one instance and re-attached to another, and the data remains intact. Block storage is implemented in OpenStack by the OpenStack Block Storage (cinder), which supports multiple back ends in the form of drivers. Your choice of a storage back end must be supported by a Block Storage driver. Most block storage drivers allow the instance to have direct access to the underlying storage hardware's block device. This helps increase the overall read/write IO. However, support for utilizing files as volumes is also well established, with full support for NFS, GlusterFS and others. These drivers work a little differently than a traditional "block" storage driver. On an NFS or GlusterFS file system, a single file is created and then mapped as a "virtual" volume into the instance. This mapping/translation is similar to how OpenStack utilizes QEMU's file-based virtual machines stored in ``/var/lib/nova/instances``.

commit_message:
Use separated SSL endpoint environment file

We shouldn't be maintaining the EndpointMap in two different repos.
This CR uses the standalone EndpointMap environment file that is now
present in t-h-t. We then add a separate endpoint list environment
file to the test-environments directory since we need it for liberty
and mitaka.

Change-Id: I967b9ee9fd5145b447fce8255ba27def458b0e91

commit_message:
Config options: improve libvirt help text (1)

This commit adds additional help text to the following
subset of options: use_usb_table, inject_password,
inject_key, inject_partition, virt_type, connection_uri,
disk_prefix, cpu_mode, cpu_model, rescue_image_id,
rescue_kernel_id, rescue_ramdisk_id.

Change-Id: I79b0339ab7fd6ee2c21ee6cce598f45236d662f0
Implements: blueprint centralize-config-options-newton
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/39/316539/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: help=""" The ID of the image to boot from to rescue data from a corrupted instance. If the rescue REST API operation doesn't provide an ID of an image to use, the image which is referenced by this ID is used instead. If this option is not set, the image from the instance is used instead. Possible values: * An ID of an image or nothing. If it points to an *Amazon Machine Image* (AMI), consider to set the config options ``rescue_kernel_id`` and ``rescue_ramdisk_id`` too. If nothing is set, the image of the instance is used instead. Services which consume this: * ``nova-compute`` Related options: * ``rescue_kernel_id``: If the chosen rescue image allows the separate definition of its kernel disk, the value of this option is used, if specified. This is the case when *Amazon*'s AMI/AKI/ARI image format is used for the rescue image. * ``rescue_ramdisk_id``: If the chosen rescue image allows the separate definition of its RAM disk, the value of this option is used if, specified. This is the case when *Amazon*'s AMI/AKI/ARI image format is used for the rescue image. """), help=""" The ID of the kernel (AKI) image to use with the rescue image. If the chosen rescue image allows the separate definition of its kernel disk, the value of this option is used, if specified. This is the case when *Amazon*'s AMI/AKI/ARI image format is used for the rescue image. Possible values: * An ID of an kernel image or nothing. If nothing is specified, the kernel disk from the instance is used if it was launched with one. Services which consume this: * ``nova-compute`` Related options: * ``rescue_image_id``: If that option points to an image in *Amazon*'s AMI/AKI/ARI image format, it's useful to use ``rescue_kernel_id`` too. """), help=""" The ID of the RAM disk (ARI) image to use with the rescue image. If the chosen rescue image allows the separate definition of its RAM disk, the value of this option is used, if specified. This is the case when *Amazon*'s AMI/AKI/ARI image format is used for the rescue image. Possible values: * An ID of a RAM disk image or nothing. If nothing is specified, the RAM disk from the instance is used if it was launched with one. Services which consume this: * ``nova-compute`` Related options: * ``rescue_image_id``: If that option points to an image in *Amazon*'s AMI/AKI/ARI image format, it's useful to use ``rescue_ramdisk_id`` too. """), help=""" Describes the virtualization type (or so called domain type) libvirt should use. The choice of this type must match the underlying virtualization strategy you have chosen for this host. Possible values: * See the predefined set of case-sensitive values. Services which consume this: * ``nova-compute`` Related options: * ``connection_uri``: depends on this * ``disk_prefix``: depends on this * ``cpu_mode``: depends on this * ``cpu_model``: depends on this """), help=""" Overrides the default libvirt URI of the chosen virtualization type. If set, Nova will use this URI to connect to libvirt. Possible values: * An URI like ``qemu:///system`` or ``xen+ssh://oirase/`` for example. This is only necessary if the URI differs to the commonly known URIs for the chosen virtualization type. Services which consume this: * ``nova-compute`` Related options: * ``virt_type``: Influences what is used as default value here. """), help=""" Allow the injection of an admin password at boot time. There is no agent needed within the image to do this. If *libguestfs* is available on the host, it will be used. Otherwise *nbd* is used. The file system of the image will be mounted and the admin password, which is provided in the REST API call will be injected as password for the root user. If no root user is available, the instance won't be launched and an error is thrown. Be aware that the injection is *not* possible when the instance gets launched from a volume. Possible values: * True: Allows the injection. * False: Disallows the injection. Any via the REST API provided admin password will be silently ignored. Services which consume this: * ``nova-compute`` Related options: * ``inject_partition``: That option will decide about the discovery and usage of the file system. It also can disable the injection at all. """), help=""" Allow the injection of an SSH key at boot time. There is no agent needed within the image to do this. If *libguestfs* is available on the host, it will be used. Otherwise *nbd* is used. The file system of the image will be mounted and the SSH key, which is provided in the REST API call will be injected as SSH key for the root user and appended to the ``authorized_keys`` of that user. The SELinux context will be set if necessary. Be aware that the injection is *not* possible when the instance gets launched from a volume. Possible values: * True: Allows the injection. * False: Disallows the injection. Any via the REST API provided SSH key will be silently ignored. Services which consume this: * ``nova-compute`` Related options: * ``inject_partition``: That option will decide about the discovery and usage of the file system. It also can disable the injection at all. """), help=""" Determines the way how the file system is chosen to inject data into it. *libguestfs* will be used a first solution to inject data. If that's not available on the host, the image will be locally mounted on the host as a fallback solution. If libguestfs is not able to determine the root partition (because there are more or less than one root partition) or cannot mount the file system it will result in an error and the instance won't be launched. Possible values: * -2 => disable the injection of data. Provided injection data will be silently ignored. * -1 => find the root partition with the file system to mount with libguestfs * 0 => The image is not partitioned * >0 => The number of the partition to use for the injection Services which consume this: * ``nova-compute`` Related options: * ``inject_key``: If this option allows the injection of a SSH key it depends on value greater or equal to -1 for ``inject_partition``. * ``inject_password``: If this option allows the injection of an admin password it depends on value greater or equal to -1 for ``inject_partition``. * ``guestfs`` You can enable the debug log level of libguestfs with this config option. A more verbose output will help in debugging issues. * ``virt_type``: If you use ``lxc`` as virt_type it will be treated as a single partition image """), help=""" Enable a mouse cursor within a graphical VNC or SPICE sessions. This will only be taken into account if the VM is fully virtualized and VNC and/or SPICE is enabled. If the node doesn't support a graphical framebuffer, then it is valid to set this to False. Possible values: * ``True``: Enables the mouse in a VNC/SPICE session * ``False``: Disables the mouse cursor Services which consume this: * ``nova-compute`` Related options: * ``[vnc]enabled``: If VNC is enabled, ``use_usb_tablet`` will have an effect. * ``[spice]enabled`` + ``[spice].agent_enabled``: If SPICE is enabled and the spice agent is disabled, the config value of ``use_usb_tablet`` will have an effect. """), help=""" Override the default disk prefix for the devices attached to an instance. If set, this is used to identify a free disk device name for a bus. Possible values: * Any prefix which will result in a valid disk device name like 'sda' or 'hda' for example. This is only necessary if the device names differ to the commonly known device name prefixes for a virtualization type such as: sd, xvd, uvd, vd. Services which consume this: * ``nova-compute`` Related options: * ``virt_type``: Influences which device type is used, which determines the default disk prefix. """), help=""" Is used to set the CPU mode an instance should have. If virt_type="kvm|qemu", it will default to "host-model", otherwise it will default to "none". Possible values: * ``host-model``: Clones the host CPU feature flags. * ``host-passthrough``: Use the host CPU model exactly; * ``custom``: Use a named CPU model; * ``none``: Not set any CPU model. Services which consume this: * ``nova-compute`` Related options: * ``cpu_model``: If ``custom`` is used for ``cpu_mode``, set this config option too, otherwise this would result in an error and the instance won't be launched. """), help=""" Set the name of the libvirt CPU model the instance should use. Possible values: * The names listed in /usr/share/libvirt/cpu_map.xml Services which consume this: * ``nova-compute`` Related options: * ``cpu_mode``: Don't set this when ``cpu_mode`` is NOT set to ``custom``. This would result in an error and the instance won't be launched. * ``virt_type``: Only the virtualization types ``kvm`` and ``qemu`` use this. """),
deleted_lines: help='Rescue ami image. This will not be used if an image id ' 'is provided by the user.'), help='Rescue aki image'), help='Rescue ari image'), help='Libvirt domain type'), help='Override the default libvirt URI ' '(which is dependent on virt_type)'), help='Inject the admin password at boot time, ' 'without an agent.'), help='Inject the ssh public key at boot time'), help='The partition to inject to : ' '-2 => disable, -1 => inspect (libguestfs only), ' '0 => not partitioned, >0 => partition number'), help='Sync virtual and real mouse cursors in Windows VMs'), help='Override the default disk prefix for the devices attached' ' to a server, which is dependent on virt_type. ' '(valid options are: sd, xvd, uvd, vd)'), help='Set to "host-model" to clone the host CPU feature flags; ' 'to "host-passthrough" to use the host CPU model exactly; ' 'to "custom" to use a named CPU model; ' 'to "none" to not set any CPU model. ' 'If virt_type="kvm|qemu", it will default to ' '"host-model", otherwise it will default to "none"'), help='Set to a named libvirt CPU model (see names listed ' 'in /usr/share/libvirt/cpu_map.xml). Only has effect if ' 'cpu_mode="custom" and virt_type="kvm|qemu"'),

commit_message:
Use %py_build and %py_install macros

The macros where introduced recently so use them in all .spec.j2 templates.

Change-Id: I0cb651405f7ac59ab25e3bdbcd0a1ca9a5fdeebf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rpm-packaging refs/changes/72/340572/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: %{py2_build}%{py2_install}

commit_message:
Fix typo in iscsi pull playbook

In ansible/roles/iscsi/tasks/pull.yml, there are references to
'iscsi', which should be 'iscsid' instead.  This patchset
fixes this typo.

Change-Id: Id2c31bf69556ec8dcf66cc1d32d2bfe77f02367b
Closes-bug: #1602566
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/90/358390/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: image: "{{ iscsid_image_full }}" when: inventory_hostname in groups['iscsid']
deleted_lines: image: "{{ iscsi_image_full }}" when: inventory_hostname in groups['iscsi']

subject: Change logic for checking failed tests in assert_ostf_run().
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-22 14:11:14.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/models/fuel_web_client.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa/commit/ac1e3e9adcb8872ec37a59ba27bcd56436d3e0dc', 'message': "Change logic for checking failed tests in assert_ostf_run().

If in list actual_failed names we have something else that
 we are ordered in failed_test_name test must be failed.
But if in list actual_failed_names we haven't all tests
 that we are ordered in failed_test_name test must be passed.

Closes bug: 1615517

Change-Id: Ibaafe43039e96d6a39b7c405ac6a0ef55d373c8c
"}]
commit_message:
Change logic for checking failed tests in assert_ostf_run().

If in list actual_failed names we have something else that
 we are ordered in failed_test_name test must be failed.
But if in list actual_failed_names we haven't all tests
 that we are ordered in failed_test_name test must be passed.

Closes bug: 1615517

Change-Id: Ibaafe43039e96d6a39b7c405ac6a0ef55d373c8c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/66/358666/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for test_name in actual_failed_names: assert_true(test_name in failed_test_name, failed_test_name, actual_failed_names) )
deleted_lines: for test_name in failed_test_name: assert_true(test_name in actual_failed_names, failed_test_name, actual_failed_names))

commit_message:
Change logic for checking failed tests in assert_ostf_run().

If in list actual_failed names we have something else that
 we are ordered in failed_test_name test must be failed.
But if in list actual_failed_names we haven't all tests
 that we are ordered in failed_test_name test must be passed.

Closes bug: 1615517

Change-Id: Ibaafe43039e96d6a39b7c405ac6a0ef55d373c8c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/65/358665/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for test_name in actual_failed_names: assert_true(test_name in failed_test_name, failed_test_name, actual_failed_names) )
deleted_lines: for test_name in failed_test_name: assert_true(test_name in actual_failed_names, failed_test_name, actual_failed_names))

commit_message:
Change logic for checking failed tests in assert_ostf_run().

If in list actual_failed names we have something else that
 we are ordered in failed_test_name test must be failed.
But if in list actual_failed_names we haven't all tests
 that we are ordered in failed_test_name test must be passed.

Closes bug: 1615517

Change-Id: Ibaafe43039e96d6a39b7c405ac6a0ef55d373c8c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/64/358664/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for test_name in actual_failed_names: assert_true(test_name in failed_test_name, failed_test_name, actual_failed_names) )
deleted_lines: for test_name in failed_test_name: assert_true(test_name in actual_failed_names, failed_test_name, actual_failed_names))

added_lines: from oslo_utils import importutils as utils self._client = None def zabbix_client_login(self): if not self.conf.zabbix.user: LOG.warning('Zabbix user is not defined') if not self.conf.zabbix.password: LOG.warning('Zabbix password is not defined') if not self.conf.zabbix.url: LOG.warning('Zabbix url is not defined') try: if not self._client: self._client = utils.import_object( 'pyzabbix.ZabbixAPI', self.conf.zabbix.url) self._client.login( self.conf.zabbix.user, self.conf.zabbix.password) except Exception as e: LOG.exception('pyzabbix.ZabbixAPI %s', e) self._client = None self.zabbix_client_login() if not self._client: self._client.host.get(output=[ZProps.HOST]) triggers = self._client.trigger.get(hostids=host_id, expandDescription=True) triggers = self._client.trigger.get(hostids=host_id, output=output)

commit_message:
Add route to instance for metadata service

Some image will not inject route for link local address. As a result, the
metadata request will go to the default route, and use the subnet gateway
mac as the dst mac of first jump. When the request arrives tap-metadata,
it will be dropped as the mac not match.

This patch will make dhcp to add a route for metadata request. So that the
metadata request will not go through the subnet gateway.

Change-Id: I21a5f503ceb2913fdf10e868142c4cf632988718
Closes-bug: #1613586

commit_message:
Use bytes to accommodate python3

python3 will not convert bytes to string implicitly. Concatenate bytes
with string will report error in python3. Just use bytes in the case.

Change-Id: Ibbec76b726a3f5fef84a4c7cf93b3c065614e133

commit_message:
Create gateway load function under storlet_gateway

This patch introduces a general load function for storlet gateway
module, which previously storlet_handler included in itself.

Change-Id: I69ec53f6aacb8893ac142d1d3b1ad42db6f7905f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/storlets refs/changes/99/357599/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2010-2016 OpenStack Foundation # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. from storlet_gateway.common.exceptions import StorletGatewayLoadError def load_gateway(module_name): module_name_sp = module_name.split(':') if not len(module_name_sp): raise StorletGatewayLoadError('Invalid module name: %s' % module_name) try: # TODO(takashi): Can we use stevedore to load module? module = __import__(module_name_sp[0], fromlist=[module_name_sp[1]]) return getattr(module, module_name_sp[1]) except (ImportError, AttributeError) as e: raise StorletGatewayLoadError('Failed to load gateway class: %s' % str(e))

commit_message:
Remove q-lbaas from this tempest list, as it is being removed

LBaaS v1 is being removed from neutron-lbaas, and lbaas support is being
removed from devstack proper (plugin only shortly.)

This change needs input from the Sahara team.

Needed-By: I98d62c13ef90b20a9c67ef4f1720efcaa366fb31
Change-Id: I2c3d43a16fbc0743d9891f607a57f67157f223c7

commit_message:
Add Node Launches to nodepool dashboard

This is a useful stat we display on each cloud, add it to nodepool
dashboard so we can see it across all clouds.

Change-Id: I32b4861ee963f1a10adf53a542457fcfd1983326
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Change skipping of tasks

because since Fuel 9.0 approach to deployment was changed

* function deploy_nodes_without_tasks was added
* using skip_tasks function was removed from node upgrade

Change-Id: I37177b90a2404d4ec41296fd726f368d90e30851
Closes-bug: 1603960
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-octane refs/changes/88/352388/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def deploy_nodes_with_tasks(env, nodes, skipped_tasks): tasks_to_execute = env.get_tasks(skip=skipped_tasks) env.execute_tasks(nodes, tasks_to_execute, False) LOG.info("Nodes deploy started. Please wait...") wait_for_nodes_tasks(env, nodes) def wait_for_nodes_tasks(env, nodes): wait_for_nodes(nodes, "ready", timeout=180 * 60) wait_for_tasks(env, "running")

commit_message:
Introduced the transactions manager

The execution one or bunch of graphs on nodes of cluster is
considered as transaction. The transaction translates
cluster from state A to state B even A and B are same.
The api call is 'POST /graphs/execute'

Change-Id: Ie0882f347d547fbc25880a3041edb0d6062fccb1
Implements: blueprint graph-concept-extension
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/91/347391/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_get_deleted_nodes(self): nodes = self.nodes[:] nodes.append(mock.MagicMock( uid=str(len(nodes) + 1), pending_deletion=True )) resolver = role_resolver.RoleResolver(nodes) self.assertItemsEqual( [n.uid for n in self.nodes], resolver.resolve("*") ) self.assertItemsEqual( [n.uid for n in self.nodes], resolver.resolve("/.*/") ) self.assertItemsEqual( [n.uid for n in nodes], resolver.resolve(["/.*/", "deleted"]) ) self.assertItemsEqual( [nodes[-1].uid], resolver.resolve(["deleted"]) )

commit_message:
Added virtual role 'deleted' for RoleResolver

This role can be used to link tasks to nodes
which were marked as deleted
The role 'deleted' does not match pattern '*' or '/.*/',
so it should be specified explicitly, for example:
"roles: ['deleted']".
Also it can be combined with other roles. for example:
"roles: ['/.*/', 'deleted']

Change-Id: I56cdf944aee594d68434c6fd8bb4d49461cb7909
Implements: blueprint graph-concept-extension

commit_message:
Remove DocBook XML publishing for trove

With change I3315261aa18729fa7a6aa79d4a1d6c24de1e2c6b trove stopped
having DocBook XML documents in it's tree. Since those are now
published from master as version-independent API docs, we can remove
the jobs completely now.

subject: Correct help text for backend option
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-18 18:40:14.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_cache/_opts.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.cache/commit/fb1c71d6aefa0ef16c58ac57abf3297fdbcfaca3', 'message': "Correct help text for backend option

The help for the backend option said that the memcache_pool backend
is recommended.

memcache_pool is there to keep a limited number of thread-associated
connections open rather than a connection for every thread. If you
don't have a huge number of threads it doesn't offer anything.
Keystone is an example of a service where memcache_pool doesn't
improve things -- eventlet isn't supported anymore and more threads
is not useful due to GIL.

As such, the help text is corrected to say to use memcache_pool for
eventlet and dogpile.cache.memcached for servers like keystone.

The help text also mentioned devstack. This is removed because
devstack is a developer tool so shouldn't be mentioned in text
targeted to operators.

Also, fixed the preceeding comment to remove redundant information
and to not mention keystone since this code isn't in keystone
anymore.

Change-Id: I1ffbf23feac623fe0bfbbe49fb3e0159dedf4cfe
"}]
commit_message:
Correct help text for backend option

The help for the backend option said that the memcache_pool backend
is recommended.

memcache_pool is there to keep a limited number of thread-associated
connections open rather than a connection for every thread. If you
don't have a huge number of threads it doesn't offer anything.
Keystone is an example of a service where memcache_pool doesn't
improve things -- eventlet isn't supported anymore and more threads
is not useful due to GIL.

As such, the help text is corrected to say to use memcache_pool for
eventlet and dogpile.cache.memcached for servers like keystone.

The help text also mentioned devstack. This is removed because
devstack is a developer tool so shouldn't be mentioned in text
targeted to operators.

Also, fixed the preceeding comment to remove redundant information
and to not mention keystone since this code isn't in keystone
anymore.

Change-Id: I1ffbf23feac623fe0bfbbe49fb3e0159dedf4cfe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.cache refs/changes/07/357407/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(morganfainberg): It is recommended that either Redis or # unintentionally, we register a no-op as the default caching backend. 'that Memcache or Redis (dogpile.cache.redis) be used ' 'in production deployments. For eventlet-based or ' 'highly threaded servers, Memcache with pooling ' '(oslo_cache.memcache_pool) is recommended. For low ' 'thread servers, dogpile.cache.memcached is ' 'recommended. Test environments with a single ' 'instance of the server can use the ' 'dogpile.cache.memory backend.'),
deleted_lines: # NOTE(morganfainberg): the dogpile.cache.memory acceptable in devstack # and other such single-process/thread deployments. Running # dogpile.cache.memory in any other configuration has the same pitfalls # as the KVS token backend. It is recommended that either Redis or # unintentionally, we register a no-op as the keystone default caching # backend. 'that Memcache with pooling ' '(oslo_cache.memcache_pool) or Redis ' '(dogpile.cache.redis) be used in production ' 'deployments. Small workloads (single process) ' 'like devstack can use the dogpile.cache.memory ' 'backend.'),

deleted_lines: "POT-Creation-Date: 2016-08-18 22:29+0000\n"msgid "Add the provider network as a gateway on the router." msgstr "プロバイダーネットワークをルーターのゲートウェイとして追加します。" msgid "Add the self-service subnet as an interface on the router." msgstr "セルフサービスサブネットをルーターのインターフェースとして追加します。" "BGP dynamic routing consists of a service plug-in and an agent. The service " "plug-in implements the Networking service extension and the agent manages " "BGP peering sessions. A cloud administrator creates and configures a BGP " "speaker using the CLI or API and manually schedules it to one or more hosts " "running the agent. Agents can reside on hosts with or without other " "Networking service agents. Prefix advertisement depends on the binding of " "external networks to a BGP speaker and the address scope of external and " "internal subnets." msgstr "" "BGP 動的ルーティングは、サービスプラグインとエージェントで構成されます。サー" "ビスプラグインは Networking サービスの API 拡張を実装し、エージェントは BGP " "ピアリングセッションの管理を行います。クラウド管理者は CLI や API を使って " "BGP スピーカーを作成、設定し、手動で BGP スピーカーを 1 つ以上のエージェント" "が動作するホストに割り当てます。エージェントは他の Networking サービスのエー" "ジェントと同じホストに置くことも別のホストに置くこともできます。プレフィック" "ス広告 (prefix advertisement) は、BGP スピーカーが関連付けられた外部ネット" "ワーク、および外部サブネットと内部サブネットのアドレススコープに基いて行われ" "ます。" msgid "" "BGP dynamic routing enables advertisement of self-service (private) network " "prefixes to physical network devices that support BGP such as routers, thus " "removing the conventional dependency on static routes. The feature relies on " "address scopes and requires knowledge of their operation for proper " "deployment." msgstr "" "BGP 動的ルーティングを使うと、セルフサービス (プライベート) ネットワークの" "ネットワークプレフィックスを、ルーターなどの BGP に対応した物理ネットワークデ" "バイスに広告できるようになります。これにより、従来からの静的経路による方法に" "依存する必要がなくなります。この機能はアドレススコープに依存しており、また、" "適切なデプロイメントを運用するだけの知識も必要です。" msgid ""msgid "" "Create a subnet on the provider network using an IP address allocation from " "the provider subnet pool." msgstr "" "プロバイダーネットワーク上にサブネットを作成します。 プロバイダーサブネット" "プールから IP アドレス割り当てを行います。" "Create a subnet on the self-service network using an IP address allocation " "from the self-service subnet pool." msgstr "" "セルフサービスネットワーク上にサブネットを作成します。 セルフサービスサブネッ" "トプールから IP アドレス割り当てを行います。" msgid ""msgid "Create and configure a router" msgstr "ルーターの作成と設定" msgid "Create the router." msgstr "ルーターを作成します。" msgid "Create the self-service network." msgstr "セルフサービスネットワークを作成します。" msgid "DVR functions similarly to IPv4." msgstr "DVR は IPv4 の場合と同様に機能します。" msgid "Distributed Virtual Routers (DVR)" msgstr "分散仮想ルーター (DVR)" "In deployments using DVR, the BGP speaker advertises floating IP addresses " "and self-service networks differently. For floating IP addresses, the BGP " "speaker advertises the floating IP agent gateway on the corresponding " "compute node as the next-hop IP address. For self-service networks using " "SNAT, the BGP speaker advertises the DVR SNAT node as the next-hop IP " "address. For example, consider a self-service network using 10.0.0.0/24, " "floating IP addresses using an arbitrary allocation within 172.24.4.0/24, " "and a SNAT gateway on 172.24.4.3." msgstr "" "DVR を使った環境では、 BGP スピーカーは Floating IP アドレスとセルフサービス" "ネットワークを違う方法で広告します。 Floating IP アドレスについては、 BGP ス" "ピーカーは、対応するコンピュートノードの Floating IP エージェントゲートウェイ" "をネクストホップ IP アドレスとして広告します。 SNAT を使うセルフサービスネッ" "トワークについては、 BGP スピーカーは、 DVR SNAT ノードをネクストホップ IP ア" "ドレスとして広告します。例えば、セルフサービスネットワークが 10.0.0.0/24 を使" "用し、 Floating IP アドレスが 172.24.4.0/24 から割り当てられ、 SNAT ゲート" "ウェイが 172.24.4.3 の場合には以下のようになります。" msgid """Replace ``ROUTER_ID`` with a suitable unique 32-bit number, typically an " "IPv4 address on the host running the agent. For example, 192.168.122.150." msgstr "" "``ROUTER_ID`` を適切な一意な 32 ビットの数値に置き換えてください。通常はエー" "ジェントを実行するホストの IPv4 アドレスを使用します。例えば、 " "192.168.122.150。" msgid """The BGP speaker advertises the next-hop IP address for the self-service " "network prefix." msgstr "" "BGP スピーカーは、セルフサービスネットワークのプレフィックスに対するネクスト" "ホップの IP アドレスを広告します。" msgid """Use the following example configuration as a template to deploy BGP dynamic " "routing in your environment. The example configuration references the " "following environment:" msgstr "" "以下の設定例を、お使いの環境に BGP 動的ルーティングをデプロイする際の雛形とし" "て使ってください。設定例では以下の環境を使用します。" msgid ""msgid "Verify router ports." msgstr "ルーターのポートを確認します。"

commit_message:
Clean imports in code

In some part in the code we import objects.
In the Openstack style guidelines they recommend to import only
modules.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#imports

Change-Id: I0f759a5544c797803d301cc21e8c9d3f4518cdce

commit_message:
Add os_watcher to OpenStack-Ansible

This patch adds a new pre-seeded git repository to OpenStack-Ansible
for deploying Watcher.

The os_watcher repository has its own core team with the general
openstack-ansible core team included with the appropriate rights to
ensure that they can act as a back-stop in case of any issues.

Needed-By: I0fdf31d5234bd7fea4114ba02c8d5ac9f164b81c
Change-Id: I54eee14c4030dc149585b7113483510fdbcaf55d

commit_message:
Automatically detect whether to test ceilometer/aodh

This patch implements an automated determination of whether the
Telemetry systems should be tested by tempest based on whether
there are hosts in the applicable host groups.

This reduces the number of variables a deployer needs to set in
order to have a functional environment.

Change-Id: I74cf323237bcbb2ee91233ffc72044aa74eac59e

subject: Clarify error message for unavailable RSS feeds
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-12 20:36:28.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_health/api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-health/commit/b5699ea69395d8b37191339bc061895037319ed9', 'message': 'Clarify error message for unavailable RSS feeds

Now that RSS feeds show give errors properly when no failures are
found vs invalid parameters are given (see also:
I48659140314a2d8737611dd0a86097f10c1f3ac8) the error message and
status code could use some clarification.

This changes the status code to 404 and specifies that no runs of

'}]
commit_message:
Clarify error message for unavailable RSS feeds

Now that RSS feeds show give errors properly when no failures are
found vs invalid parameters are given (see also:
I48659140314a2d8737611dd0a86097f10c1f3ac8) the error message and
status code could use some clarification.

This changes the status code to 404 and specifies that no runs of
any kind could be found with a given metadata key/value pair.

Change-Id: I14c42e2d64203204197cf9a708fb26ecd9961898
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-health refs/changes/71/355071/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: msg = 'No matching runs found with %s=%s' % ( return abort(make_response(msg, 404))
deleted_lines: msg = 'No Failed Runs for run metadata %s: %s' % ( return abort(make_response(msg, 400))

subject: Follow up delayed reap probe test
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-16 01:08:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/5e94e52f2a121c164fd44d8748bc4e2e5546c2cb', 'message': 'Follow up delayed reap probe test

This is a follow up patch for https://review.openstack.org/#/c/321041

This patch includes following items:

- Move test_sync to below _verify_account_reaped to be the actual tests
  as a bunch
- Change the test name fron "test_sync" to "test_reap" to clarify the
  purpose
- Fix a typo from "Object" to "Container" for an error message
- Add tearDownClass method calling resetswift to cleanup the account

Note that 4th item is for reusing the environment for other tests.

For example, if we run this reaping test alone likely

 nosetests test/probe/test_account_reaper.py

That will remain deleted accounts in the Swift. After that we *might*
want to run functests via "AUTH_test" like:

 nosetests test/functional/test_account.py

However, the existing deleted account db will block to create AUTH_test
account for a week (in default). This is so bad because tester will take
much time to make sure the reason why the acount has gone.

Change-Id: I51bc01113056e2eb99f731d38e9f1c7a6c5c96be

commit_message:
Follow up delayed reap probe test

This is a follow up patch for https://review.openstack.org/#/c/321041

This patch includes following items:

- Move test_sync to below _verify_account_reaped to be the actual tests
  as a bunch
- Change the test name fron "test_sync" to "test_reap" to clarify the
  purpose
- Fix a typo from "Object" to "Container" for an error message

Change-Id: I51bc01113056e2eb99f731d38e9f1c7a6c5c96be
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/83/355683/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from test.probe.common import ReplProbeTest, ENABLED_POLICIES, resetswift @classmethod def tearDownClass(cls): # This test can leave an unreclaimable account (for a week in default) # which blocks to create AUTH_test account in your Swift environment # so that call resetswift explicitly after all tests ran. resetswift() def test_reap(self): # run the reaper Manager(['account-reaper']).once() self._verify_account_reaped() self.fail( "Nothing should be reaped. Container should exist")
deleted_lines: from test.probe.common import ReplProbeTest, ENABLED_POLICIES def test_sync(self): # run the reaper Manager(['account-reaper']).once() self._verify_account_reaped() self.fail("Nothing should be reaped. Object should exist")

commit_message:
py3: tox.ini: use substituation to py35 commands

Use tox substitution to avoid duplicating testenv:py34 commands in
testenv:py35, to not have to maintain the whitelist of Python 3 tests
in two different places.

Write also the list of tests in a newline to be able to more easily
add new unit tests.

Change-Id: I6e7f238f1c5d3fc9b6560918dcbb93e9dd8ec084
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/27/358527/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: nosetests \ test/unit/common/test_exceptions.pycommands = {[testenv:py34]commands}

commit_message:
A DisableModules fixture that removes modules from path

This is a refactor of a fixture we use in keystonemiddleware for
removing modules from the python path.

Because of the way python works this typically means it only works on
modules that are imported inline or are reloaded manually.

Change-Id: Ib384e1910ca292fce81ccdd4ff857b64ee8d5a21

commit_message:
api-ref - software config status codes

This patch fixes the formatting of status codes returned from API calls.
This change is leveraging the new status_code stanza supported by new
version of os-api-ref library.

Change-Id: Ib108e04b08c88696eadabf7bc32b41f47c0ead80

commit_message:
api-ref - template version and functions

This patch fixes problems found in api-ref documentation about template
versions and template functions. The detailed changes include:

- Fixed status codes for the related APIs;
- Fixed response parameters which were missing in original doc;
- Fixed dcumentation about template-validate API where some request
  parameters were not documented.

Change-Id: I72d4a19e36f3bb3d139becd308ebcdf4103c2570

commit_message:
api-ref - stack snapshots

This patch fixes problems in api-ref doc for stack snapshots releated
APIs. The specific changes include:

- Added response parameter/example for stack-restore API;
- Renamed stack-show-snapshot-response to stack-snapshot-show-response
  for consistency.
- Fixed parameter reference for software-config related to status
  and status_reason.
- Added missing docs for response codes.
- Removed some parameters which never appears in snapshot list calls;
- Reordered docs about API calls so the flow becomes: create, list,
  show, restore and delete.

Change-Id: Iff5d671da597f640eb59d28e1533e3f6506f622c

commit_message:
api-ref - stack identity usage in find calls

The Heat API for find-stack accepts either the stack name or the stack
UUID when retrieving the canonical URL for a stack resource. The
current documentation is inaccurate because it is described as only
accepting stack names.

Change-Id: Ic2dba4314d5fc7e8bef460e92d94b92f87635d71

commit_message:
Added oslo-messaging exchange 'congress'

To conform with convention and to avoid any clashing with other
projects on oslo-messaging.

Reference:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Oslo/Messaging
Exchange: containers within which each project's topics are scoped

Change-Id: Id84f11ec95d33ce3922c464d0afa546750e21944

added_lines: import functools def translate_exception(function): """Wraps a method to catch exceptions. If the exception is not an instance of ZunException, translate it into one. """ @functools.wraps(function) def decorated_function(self, context, *args, **kwargs): try: return function(self, context, *args, **kwargs) except Exception as e: if not isinstance(e, exception.ZunException): e = exception.ZunException("Unexpected Error: %s" % str(e)) raise e return decorated_function @translate_exception @translate_exception def container_list(self, context): LOG.debug('Listing container...', context=context) @translate_exception @translate_exception @translate_exception @translate_exception @translate_exception LOG.exception(_LE("Unexpected exception: %s,"), str(e)) @translate_exception @translate_exception @translate_exception

commit_message:
Use tempest.conf when running under tempest

This change switches to a global config for heat_integrationtests, and
makes that global config the tempest config when running under
tempest.

After the transition to tempest init_conf won't be required at all.

blueprint tempest-plugin-support

Change-Id: Id22e7a03601db5adfc0b428004a75990278369a6

commit_message:
Fix post and periodic jobs

The usage of zuul-cloner in tox_install breaks post and periodic jobs.
Update the script, it does not need to handle unconstrainted installs
anymore (see tox.ini). There's no need to set ZUUL_BRANCH explicitely
- it's set via the environment and branch is passed in as well.

Note that this script is needed for the edit-constraints call, add a
comment.

Change-Id: I0077c986a17d6bb92791474e03d1e77776e9382f
Closes-Bug: #1615430

the minified file.

commit_message:
Override client() for RoleAssignment resources

It seems we've missed to override client() methods for some
keystone resource plugins.

This also fixes the tests for all keystone resources.

Change-Id: I97e4d4f0bbc9575109d9c8f59fe4795313d2f525
Closes-Bug: #1614400
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/13/357013/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def client(self): return super(KeystoneUserRoleAssignment, self).client().client def client(self): return super(KeystoneGroupRoleAssignment, self).client().client

commit_message:
Revert "Re-Release xstatic-angular-smart-table 1.4.13.0"

It seems that the release process failed for this repo again. We have
releases that have succeeded with this process, so it may take a little
more investigation.

https://pypi.python.org/pypi/XStatic-smart-table

This reverts commit 2f3a9d306c11a70e4cefbcba0baba61c11fe0f0a.

Change-Id: Ib6c9df70ceb751ddc77f8520b47b948cfa33cc77

commit_message:
Improve error message for empty cached_nwinfo

The error currently returned when NetworkInfo isn't yet available for an
active instance is confusing for end users. This change updates that
error message to something more informative.

Change-Id: Ia1a88a63d2b1a2e595404e502f8094127135d7b0
Closes-bug: #1608726
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/87/353687/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: msg = _('Instance network is not ready yet')
deleted_lines: msg = _('No nw_info cache associated with instance')

commit_message:
Update to Ansible 2.1.1

This patch bumps the openstack-ansible-security role to use Ansible
2.1 and adds the python-apt package which is now required for
Ansible's check mode on Ubuntu.

Change-Id: I4899e426a7bb5623837704b49920847c1308af53

commit_message:
Add SNI support to magnum role via OS packages

Some Linux distributions, such as CentOS 7 and Xenial, have trouble
validating SSL certificates when using get_url with servers
that use Server Name Indication (SNI).

This patch adds those packages to the list of required packages and
uses bindep to install them in developer test environments the same
way that the gate tests install them.
Add SNI support to ops role via OS packages

Change-Id: Ie7e2380bb12f28fc06fb884cb937f59abf0e620e

commit_message:
Add SNI support to memcached_server role via OS packages

Some Linux distributions, such as CentOS 7 and Xenial, have trouble
validating SSL certificates when using get_url with servers
that use Server Name Indication (SNI).

This patch adds those packages to the list of required packages and
uses bindep to install them in developer test environments the same
way that the gate tests install them.

Change-Id: I08e081c77eb034111d43b7d1a10e3c69c5a72383

commit_message:
Condense amphora-agent-ubuntu in to amphora-agent

This reverts commit fdde4e69846bda02e49c636fed991ba86318183d.

This was reverted due to an issue with starting the service on boot. A
trick of using symlinks was being attempted in order to refer to files
in the base source directory from an element. This seems to not work, so
copying init scripts in to the elments themselves.

Change-Id: If6ae07fa4ab4f39e2a339e17fbcc163b863ccd3a

commit_message:
bay-config return absolute path

Currently bay-config returns relative path. In case current
working directory is changed then relative path will not work.
Changes has been made to return absolute path. Which solve the
problem introduced by relative path.

Change-Id: I66174efa08ebe33210feb603a3fa36f396add575
Closes-bug: #1614682

commit_message:
Use upper constraints for all jobs in tox.ini

Openstack infra now supports upper constraints for
all jobs. Updated tox.ini to use upper constraints
for all jobs.

Change-Id: Id6080cf39ff5c50bc85b576247822040ccaae445
Closes-Bug: #1614361

commit_message:
Clean imports in code

In some part in the code we import objects.
In the Openstack style guidelines they recommend to import only
modules.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#imports

Change-Id: I8813c92c23f50f3b46f6cde2f609a384d7afc3c6

subject: Change Scheduler schema

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-17 11:14:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/mistral/commit/5de2f0d7346324512bc6bcb5574697dec87af91f', 'message': "Change Scheduler schema

* Dropped 'unique_key' column with unique constraint because in
  practice it causes DB deadlocks (at least on MySQL) while
  simultaneously inserting and updating the table
* Instead of 'unique_key' column we added non-unique 'key' column
  that can potentially be used for squashing delayed calls
  by scheduler itself (not implemented yet)
* Adjusted Scheduler implementation and tests accordingly

commit_message:
Change Scheduler schema

* Dropped 'unique_key' column with unique constraint because in
  practice it causes DB deadlocks (at least on MySQL) while
  simultaneously inserting and updating the table
* Instead of 'unique_key' column we added non-unique 'key' column
  that can potentially be used for squashing delayed calls
  by scheduler itself (not implemented yet)
* Adjusted Scheduler implementation and tests accordingly

Change-Id: I6df40554fcad6ca154cb19d902c3426556476dca

all jobs. Updated tox.ini to use upper constraints
for all jobs.

subject: Use private_v4 for the interface_ip when public_v4 is not present
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-12 03:12:53.000000000', 'files': ['shade/meta.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/shade/commit/4b987d381d183c82ac5cc13a6a831dc43ff15a2b', 'message': 'Use private_v4 for the interface_ip when public_v4 is not present

This patch extends add_server_interfaces to use private_v4 for the interface_ip
when public_v4 is not present but private_v4 is.

The patch fixes an issue that occurs on some public clouds (eg Catalyst Cloud
in NZ) where the openstack.py Ansible dynamic inventory script only lists
instances that have floating ips. This is caused by openstack.py ignoring
instances that do not have interface_ip set. This patch ensures that
interface_ip is populated using private_v4 for instances that do not have a
public_v4 address set.

Change-Id: Id712ccd932029855c193374fc424c07fb7e2c30d
'}]
commit_message:
Use private_v4 for the interface_ip when public_v4 is not present

This patch extends add_server_interfaces to use private_v4 for the interface_ip
when public_v4 is not present but private_v4 is.

The patch fixes an issue that occurs on some public clouds (eg Catalyst Cloud
in NZ) where the openstack.py Ansible dynamic inventory script only lists
instances that have floating ips. This is caused by openstack.py ignoring
instances that do not have interface_ip set. This patch ensures that
interface_ip is populated using private_v4 for instances that do not have a
public_v4 address set.

Change-Id: Id712ccd932029855c193374fc424c07fb7e2c30d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/70/304370/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: elif (server['private_v4'] and not server['public_v4']): interface_ip = server['private_v4']

commit_message:
sqlite_db has been deprecated to be removed

As this option has been deprecated, it needs to be removed. The
connection string is sufficient enough to make the tests work.

The extra kwarg being used in the set_defaults method was generating
unnecessary logs so, this change is being proposed. This will help with
testing locally and in the gate.

Change-Id: I2ac77f0eebf4fa88a364461f38e4b626800e0d0a

commit_message:
Avoid to use pass in exception

We use pass in some ignorable Exception, which we should at less log
debug message.

Change-Id: Ia1790cf3abca0d4cc83b92123ce035cf555bd8e0

deleted_lines: except exception.NotFound: pass except exception.NoActionRequired: pass except exception.NotFound: pass

commit_message:
Remove constraint directory

Origin constraint directory is design to contain all constraints, but
since
we're more prefer to contain constraints by each resources themself,
there is no point to keep this directory anymore. This patch propose to
deprecate this directory, move common constraints to common directory.

Change-Id: Idef927428223f7cde47d2d8c7edeb4f5d2572bc8

commit_message:
Changed the CLI style

Remove the "container-" prefix in CLI to make the style closer
to Nova (i.e. nova boot ...) and Docker CLI (docker create ...).
* zun container-create -> zun create
* container-list -> zun list
* container-show -> zun show
* container-delete -> zun delete
* container-start -> zun start
* container-stop -> zun stop
* container-pause -> zun pause
* container-unpause -> zun unpause
* container-reboot -> zun reboot
* container-logs -> zun logs
* container-exec -> zun exec

Change-Id: I4dfc908c617142babcb9b68087b746dd6583ca35

commit_message:
Increase log level for OVN port status updates

To aid debugging vif binding problems in a production environment,
increasing the logging level for OVN port status updates from debug
to info. This level aligns better with the nova vif plugged messages
which are logged at the info level.

Change-Id: I65bc4254f9476605e81254931530894a9ddcbe0d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/28/358828/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOG.info("OVN reports status up for port: %s", port_id) LOG.info("OVN reports status down for port: %s", port_id)
deleted_lines: LOG.debug("OVN reports status up for port: %s", port_id) LOG.debug("OVN reports status down for port: %s", port_id)

commit_message:
Automatically enable the cinder backup service

This patch implements an automated determination of whether the
cinder backup service should be enabled based on whether there
are swift hosts in the environment.

This reduces the number of variables a deployer needs to set in
order to have a functional environment.

Change-Id: I0fd9afea9e962b61d255b86ba894afb96e84e58f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/64/358264/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # If there are Swift hosts in the environment, then enable cinder backups to it cinder_service_backup_program_enabled: "{{ ((groups['swift_all'] is defined) and (groups['swift_all'] | length > 0) }}"

subject: Support pylint 1.5.4 for neutron-fwaas
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-12 21:48:02.000000000', 'files': ['.pylintrc'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-fwaas/commit/c3c12f9434f144ff79ad938ed052eb7302259ad9', 'message': 'Support pylint 1.5.4 for neutron-fwaas

Add nonstandard-exception, redefined-variable-type and
wrong-import-order to .pylintrc disable controls.

The newer version of pylint now flags these issues by default,
and legacy code such as the mcafee drivers that are not easily
modified and tested get flagged.  For example,
Module neutron_fwaas.services.firewall.drivers.mcafee.ngfw_fwaas
R:151,12: Redefinition of max_port type from str to int
(redefined-variable-type)

Disabling maintains consistency with pylint <1.5 yet
allows more recent pylint to be used as well as the older
versions.

Change-Id: I3a38904d8d5192170384d4db3fa461e801c48a4e
'}]
commit_message:
Support pylint 1.5.4 for neutron-fwaas

Add nonstandard-exception, redefined-variable-type and
wrong-import-order to .pylintrc disable controls.

The newer version of pylint now flags these issues by default,
and legacy code such as the mcafee drivers that are not easily
modified and tested get flagged.  For example,
Module neutron_fwaas.services.firewall.drivers.mcafee.ngfw_fwaas
R:151,12: Redefinition of max_port type from str to int
(redefined-variable-type)

Disabling maintains consistency with pylint <1.5 yet
allows more recent pylint to be used as well as the older
versions.

Change-Id: I3a38904d8d5192170384d4db3fa461e801c48a4e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-fwaas refs/changes/17/279817/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: nonstandard-exception, redefined-variable-type, wrong-import-order,

commit_message:
Enhance test_ovn_db_sync to verify lrp.networks

This patch enhances test_ovn_db_sync to verify lrp.networks members.
(No matter we set lrp.networks with list type or net type in futrue,
elements checking will always help us confirm data get inserted
correctly.)

Change-Id: Iad7bba20b0843d8418d0fc06f4dd2d2e15023b4a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/84/344584/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016 Red Hat, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from networking_ovn.tests.functional import base from neutron.agent.ovsdb.native import idlutils class TestOvnL3(base.TestOVNFunctionalBase): def setUp(self): super(TestOvnL3, self).setUp() self.net = self._make_network(self.fmt, 'n1', True) self.router = self.l3_plugin.create_router( self.context, {'router': {'name': 'r1', 'admin_state_up': True, 'tenant_id': self._tenant_id}}) def _validate_router_and_router_ports(self, r_ports_num=1): r_ports = self._list('ports', query_params='device_id=%s' % self.router['id']) r_port_ids = [p['id'] for p in r_ports['ports']] self.assertEqual(r_ports_num, len(r_port_ids)) try: lrouter = idlutils.row_by_value( self.mech_driver._nb_ovn.idl, 'Logical_Router', 'name', 'neutron-' + str(self.router['id']), None) lports = getattr(lrouter, 'ports', []) plugin_lrouter_port_ids = [lport.name.replace('lrp-', '') for lport in lports] except idlutils.RowNotFound: plugin_lrouter_port_ids = [] self.assertItemsEqual(r_port_ids, plugin_lrouter_port_ids) for p in r_ports['ports']: r_port_networks = self.l3_plugin.get_networks_for_lrouter_port( self.context, p['fixed_ips']) try: lport = idlutils.row_by_value( self.mech_driver._nb_ovn.idl, 'Logical_Router_Port', 'name', 'lrp-' + str(p['id']), None) lport_networks = getattr(lport, 'networks', []) except idlutils.RowNotFound: lport_networks = [] self.assertItemsEqual(r_port_networks, lport_networks) def test_add_router_interface_with_ip4_subnets(self): res = self._create_subnet(self.fmt, self.net['network']['id'], '10.0.0.0/24') n1_s1 = self.deserialize(self.fmt, res) self.l3_plugin.add_router_interface( self.context, self.router['id'], {'subnet_id': n1_s1['subnet']['id']}) self._validate_router_and_router_ports() res = self._create_subnet(self.fmt, self.net['network']['id'], '20.0.0.0/24') n1_s2 = self.deserialize(self.fmt, res) self.l3_plugin.add_router_interface( self.context, self.router['id'], {'subnet_id': n1_s2['subnet']['id']}) self._validate_router_and_router_ports(r_ports_num=2) def test_add_router_interface_with_ip6_subnets(self): res = self._create_subnet(self.fmt, self.net['network']['id'], '2001:db8::/64', ip_version=6) n1_s1 = self.deserialize(self.fmt, res) self.l3_plugin.add_router_interface( self.context, self.router['id'], {'subnet_id': n1_s1['subnet']['id']}) self._validate_router_and_router_ports() res = self._create_subnet(self.fmt, self.net['network']['id'], '2001:dba::/64', ip_version=6) n1_s2 = self.deserialize(self.fmt, res) self.l3_plugin.add_router_interface( self.context, self.router['id'], {'subnet_id': n1_s2['subnet']['id']}) self._validate_router_and_router_ports()

commit_message:
Fix model/migration sync issues with FWaaS

After the merge of the FWaaS DB patch, numerous DB issues were identified with
the Midonet gate jobs due to model/migration mismatches.  This patch resolves
those errors.

Change-Id: Ida038a486c95f8320f567c7b3a80a674270262a3

subject: align lrouter port networks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-22 17:28:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/8138f6a0bd987272c362916f55688393d43da8e2', 'message': "WIP align lrouter port networks

In OVN, a router port with multiple IPv6 addresses will have
multiple addresses records in Logical_Switch_Port 'addresses'
column, but its peer port in Logical_Router_Port will have
only one IPv6 address in 'network' column. It's inconsistant.

This patch will try to fix that.

Change-Id: If2d097bb23a0b9604d95dd3659eba58a7776d7b0
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-13 16:31:54.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/ovsdb/ovn_api.py', 'networking_ovn/ovsdb/impl_idl_ovn.py', 'networking_ovn/ovsdb/commands.py', 'networking_ovn/tests/unit/l3/test_l3_ovn.py', 'networking_ovn/l3/l3_ovn.py', 'networking_ovn/tests/unit/fakes.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/06639166278b3f68a00ed5e4759bae5f6de2cf05', 'message': 'align lrouter port networks

According to
https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/blob/master/ovn/ovn-nb.ovsschema#L126-L128

Change-Id: If2d097bb23a0b9604d95dd3659eba58a7776d7b0

commit_message:
align lrouter port networks

According to
https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/blob/master/ovn/ovn-nb.ovsschema#L126-L128
ovn-nb Logical_Router_Port has updated its column network to networks
now.

This patch align networking-ovn code to fit that changing.

Change-Id: If2d097bb23a0b9604d95dd3659eba58a7776d7b0

commit_message:
Use upper constraints for all jobs in tox.ini

Openstack infra now supports upper constraints for
all jobs. Updated tox.ini to use upper constraints
for all jobs.

Change-Id: Ibb49105fea5f119d181e7fd6f78ca6cf72ada33f
Closes-Bug: #1614361

It can be removed when infra changes this. install_command = pip install -U {opts} {packages}# NOTE(amrith) The setting of the install_command in this location # is only required because currently infra does not actually # support constraints files for the cover job, and while # the environment variable UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is set, there's # no file there. It can be removed when infra changes this. install_command = pip install -U {opts} {packages}

commit_message:
[dev-docs] Changed location of a class

Changed location of BaseComputePollster class from
ceilometer/compute/__init__.py to
ceilometer/compute/pollsters/__init__.py.
Also changed ceilometer.compute.BaseComputePollster to
ceilometer.compute.pollsters.BaseComputePollster

Change-Id: I82e9bf595dca1959335ad028e7d362291e3fc1d6
Closes-Bug: #1613897

Make execute results human-readable

1. Use stdout_str and stderr_str instead of logging object
2. Deprecated methods replaced by it's successors

Related-bug: #1585194
(cherry picked from commit 3bf6b0a)
(cherry picked from commit 0e874b8)

commit_message:
Forbid interfaces configuration of error node

Now it is possible to configure interfaces of not deployed node only,
including a new cluster node that has discovering error (error_type = 'discover').

Closes-Bug: #1604470

Change-Id: I52246093e46bd3825b5684c6c6d4e0c8f81479aa

commit_message:
Move test_fuel_migration from system tests to pytest

Implements blueprint migrate-fuel-qa-from-proboscis-nose-frameworks

Change-Id: I1ec6b06f5083c1250c86f5eea51041bd2e728be9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/09/345509/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @pytest.mark.test_fuel_master_migration def test_fuel_master_migration(self): """Fuel master migration to VM Scenario: 1. Create environment 2. Run network checker 3. Deploy environment 4. Run network checker 5. Migrate Fuel Master to the compute node 6. Run network checker 7. commit_message:
Make execute results human-readable

1. Use stdout_str and stderr_str instead of logging object
2. stdout_str and stderr_str is calculated by SSHClient
3. Deprecated methods replaced by it's successors

Change-Id: I86a937a10ad1d62250a4cd771af2f66da62784b2
Related-bug: #1585194

Add memory to overcloud vms up to 6144

CI HA jobs fail because memory shortage, this patch increases
memory for overcloud to 6144 MB
Closes-Bug: 1611842
